tv.freewheel.ad.interfaces

Interface IAdContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IParameterHolder
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICTSAdContext

    public interface IAdContext
extends IParameterHolder
    IAdContext is the main facade for ad requesting, should be created in each Activity that wants to display Ads.

    • Method Detail

      • getConstants

        IConstants getConstants()
        Get constants look up table.
        Returns:
        an IConstants object

      • registerVideoDisplayBase

        void registerVideoDisplayBase(android.widget.FrameLayout videoDisplayBase)
        Set the FrameLayout on which the temporal ads will be drawn.
        AdManager will use it to find where to play the temporal ads. Video ads will fill the FrameLayout and overlay ads will be put at a certain position of the FrameLayout.
        Parameters:
        videoDisplayBase - the FrameLayout on which the temporal ads will be drawn

      • setActivity

        void setActivity(android.app.Activity activity)
        Set the Activity object which create this adContext.
        An Ad Context should be attached to an Activity.
        Parameters:
        activity - the Activity this IAdContext is attached to

      • getActivity

        android.app.Activity getActivity()
        Return application's current Activity which create and hold the reference of this AdContext.
        Returns:
        the Activity object

      • setActivityState

        void setActivityState(IConstants.ActivityState state)
        Set activity state on AdContext. Should be invoked when activity's state changes. i.e. in Activity.onCreate -> ActivityState.CREATED Activity.onStart -> ActivityState.STARTED Activity.onRestart -> ActivityState.RESTARTED Activity.onPause -> ActivityState.PAUSED Activity.onResume -> ActivityState.RESUMED Activity.onStop -> ActivityState.STOPPED Activity.onDestroy -> ActivityState.DESTROYED
        Parameters:
        state - state of the activity

      • setVideoState

        void setVideoState(IConstants.VideoState videoState)
        Set the playback state of content video asset (video state in AdContext should be always in sync with the content video assets playback state)
        Parameters:
        videoState - the state of the content video asset

      • setContentVideoPlayheadTime

        void setContentVideoPlayheadTime(double playheadTime)
        Set the current playhead time of the content video asset (should not contain the duration of ads)
        Parameters:
        playheadTime - playhead time of the content video asset

      • setParameter

        void setParameter(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.Object value,
                  IConstants.ParameterLevel level)
        Set the parameters for a special level.
        Parameters:
        name - key of the parameter to be set
        value - value for the key
        level - level of the parameter

      • getSlotByCustomId

        ISlot getSlotByCustomId(java.lang.String customId)
        Get a slots by its customId.
        Parameters:
        customId - custom id of the slot
        Returns:
        an ISlot object, or null if not found

      • getSlotsByTimePositionClass

        java.util.List<ISlot> getSlotsByTimePositionClass(IConstants.TimePositionClass timePositionClass)
        Get all slots by time position class
        Parameters:
        timePositionClass - enumerated value of searching time position class
        Returns:
        a non-null List of ISlot objects matching searching time position class

      • getTemporalSlots

        java.util.List<ISlot> getTemporalSlots()
        Get all the temporal slots.
        Returns:
        a List of ISlot objects, will return an empty list if none found

      • getSiteSectionNonTemporalSlots

java.util.List<ISlot> getSiteSectionNonTemporalSlots()
        Deprecated. Please use getNonTemporalSlots() instead

      • getNonTemporalSlots

        java.util.List<ISlot> getNonTemporalSlots()
        Get all the non-temporal slots.
        Returns:
        a List of ISlot objects, will return an empty list if none found

      • submitRequestWithConfiguration

        void submitRequestWithConfiguration(AdRequestConfiguration config,
                                    double timeoutSeconds)
        Construct the request with the an AdRequestConfiguration class object and Submit the request to FreeWheel Ad Server. Each AdContext can only submitRequest once.
        Parameters:
        config - AdRequestConfiguration object
        timeoutSeconds - timeout time in seconds for this request

      • addRenderer

        void addRenderer(java.lang.String className,
                 java.lang.String baseUnit,
                 java.lang.String soldAsAdUnit,
                 java.lang.String contentType,
                 java.lang.String slotType,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)

      • addRenderer

        void addRenderer(java.lang.String className,
                 java.lang.String baseUnit,
                 java.lang.String soldAsAdUnit,
                 java.lang.String contentType,
                 java.lang.String slotType,
                 java.lang.String creativeAPI,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Parameters:
        className - class name of renderer. Please note, class name is expected to have prefix "class://" and the package namespace
        baseUnit - the base ad units that the renderer can support, separated by comma
        soldAsAdUnit - the soldAs ad unit that the renderer can support, separated by comma
        contentType - the content types that the renderer can support, separated by comma
        slotType - the slot types that the renderer can support, separated by comma
        creativeAPI - the creative APIs that the renderer can support, separated by comma
        parameters - the parameters set on renderer level

      • addEventListener

        void addEventListener(java.lang.String type,
                      IEventListener listener)
        Register an event listener.
        Parameters:
        type - name of the event to listen to
        listener - the listener

      • removeEventListener

        void removeEventListener(java.lang.String type,
                         IEventListener listener)
        Remove an event listener.
        Parameters:
        type - the name of the event to listen to
        listener - the listener

      • dispatchEvent

        void dispatchEvent(IEvent event)

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Dispose this AdContext object and remove all event listeners of it, stop all playing slots.
        After this call, all other methods should not be invoked in this adContext.

      • getVideoLocation

        java.lang.String getVideoLocation()
        Get video asset's url location.
        Returns:
        a String set by API setVideoAsset's location parameter, or null if not set

      • getAdManager

        IAdManager getAdManager()
        Get the AdManager object which create the current AdContext.
        Returns:
        an IAdManager object

      • notifyUserAction

        void notifyUserAction(IConstants.UserAction userAction)
        Notify AdManager and its modules with user's action
        Parameters:
        userAction - action performed by the user

      • loadExtension

        void loadExtension(java.lang.String name)
        Load player extension from given URL which implements IExtension.
        Event IConstants.EVENT_EXTENSION_LOADED will be fired when an extension succeeds or fails to initialize.
        Parameters:
        name - a String identifier of the extension

      • setAdVolume

        void setAdVolume(float volume)
        Set volume for current and subsequent ad playbacks. Note: A VPAID creative not implementing setAdVolume VPAID spec will not change its volume. Note that the events EVENT_AD_VOLUME_CHANGED, EVENT_AD_MUTE and EVENT_AD_UNMUTE won't be dispatched if IAdContext.setAdVolume() is called before the ad playback starts. However, the specified volume will be applied to the ad when it starts playback.
        Parameters:
        volume - volume is expected in range [0,1]

      • getAdVolume

        float getAdVolume()
        Get ad playback volume. Note: Ad playback volume is influenced by the player, renderer or creatives (VPAID). The value returned is the value set by the latest influence
        Returns:
        A float value in the range [0,1]
